task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the target, align the circular tool to the block, push it along a planned direction toward the target, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style robot with a circular end-effector interacts with a red T-shaped block on a white tabletop. A blue drawn circle on the surface serves as the goal region, and a light blue T outline provides alignment context. The behavior emphasizes visual detection, alignment with tight tolerance, a single directed push, and a short retreat to avoid accidental contact after motion. Both observation and control are effectively discrete at 10 Hz, so actions should be brief and robust to small pose noise.
preconditions: Camera provides view of table and objects
Goal region visible on the surface
Robot free of collisions and within reach
stepwise_plan: Approach and align tool to a pushing edge with tight tolerance
Set the tool yaw for a straight push
Execute a straight push toward the target
success_criteria: Block centroid ends within the goal region
Robot retreats clear of the object and target area
failure_and_recovery: Misalignment → re-approach and align with tighter tolerance
Insufficient motion → repeat push with same direction
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when push completes and robot has retreated with no active contact.

frame_3.now_evidence: First firm contact with the T block and alignment cue from the T outline.
frame_3.predicts_next: Initiation of the push along the chosen direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Find the T-shaped block in the scene.
Verify the block remains visible before approaching.
Bring tool to a precise pre-push pose aligned to a block face.
Orient tool so the push is approximately straight toward the goal.
Execute the push to move the block toward the target.
Back off to avoid post-push collisions.

assumptions: Color mismatch: frames show a red T block and a blue goal circle, while instruction mentions gray block and green target; we treat the visible blue circle as the target.
Push direction approximated as 90° based on contact geometry in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Block inside goal circle after push
Robot ends in a clear, non-contact pose
